001package io.github.ai4ci.config.setup;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004
005import org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultEdge;
006import org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleGraph;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonSubTypes;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonSubTypes.Type;
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonTypeInfo;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonTypeInfo.Id;
013
014import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person;
015
016/**
017 * Abstract configuration for network generation used during model setup.
018 *
019 * <p>
020 * Concrete implementations provide parameters for specific graph generation
021 * algorithms (for example Erdos‑Reyni, Watts‑Strogatz and Barabasi‑Albert). The
022 * configuration objects are consumed by the model builder during the
023 * {@code setupOutbreak} stage to create the social network used by the
024 * simulation.
025 *
026 * <p>
027 * Extension guidance: to add a new network type implement a new configuration
028 * class and add it to the Jackson polymorphic mapping above (or register it
029 * with your object mapper). Keep generation logic in the configuration's
030 * {@link #generateGraph} method so the builder can remain generic.
031 * </p>
032 *
033 * @author Rob Challen
034 */
035@JsonTypeInfo(use = Id.SIMPLE_NAME)
036@JsonSubTypes(
037        { @Type(
038                        value = ImmutableWattsStrogatzConfiguration.class,
039                        name = "watts-strogatz"
040        ), @Type(value = ImmutableErdosReyniConfiguration.class,
041                        name = "erdos-reyni"
042        ), @Type(value = ImmutableBarabasiAlbertConfiguration.class,
043                        name = "barabasi-albert"
044        ) }
045)
046public interface NetworkConfiguration extends Serializable {
047
048        /**
049         * Generate a social network graph according to the concrete configuration
050         * parameters.
051         *
052         * <p>
053         * Builders pass an empty {@link SimpleGraph} and expect the method to
054         * populate it with nodes and edges. Implementations should add nodes and
055         * edges deterministically from the configuration values so results can be
056         * reproduced when the same seed is used.
057         *
058         * @param socialNetwork mutable graph to populate with nodes and edges
059         */
060        @JsonIgnore
061        void generateGraph(SimpleGraph<Person, DefaultEdge> socialNetwork);
062
063        /**
064         * Model parameter: target average degree for the generated network.
065         *
066         * @return the average number of social network contacts
067         */
068        Integer getNetworkDegree();
069
070        /**
071         * Model parameter: number of agents to generate in the network.
072         *
073         * @return the number of agents in the model
074         */
075        Integer getNetworkSize();
076
077}
